text: or someone that's just starting off the
first thing I would say talk to your
fellow trainers they're your best
resource out there for resources outside
the game to use the best ones that I
could recommend or reddit the pokemon
ghost subreddit and the Pokemon Go NYC
reddit and I think there's one for just
about every major city or area and then
there's also the the Silk Road subreddit
which all those have a lot of great
information so if you're gonna do a lot
of egg hatching number one you need some
comfortable walking shoes if you go for
too long my experience was my feet get a
little sore by the end of the day I
walked about an average of eight miles a
day and some of the other rarest pok√©mon
like Snorlax and Lapras or ones that I
got from the 10-kilometer eggs so you
have to walk about six miles to get
those to hatch the best thing that you
can spend money on is the egg incubators
in the game they costs about 33 cents
per egg hatched so that that's a really
good way to get some of the rarest
Pokemon and if you're going to be doing
all that walking you definitely want to
do it in a straight line the way the
game works is that it uses a distance
displacement calculation in order to
track distance so it's not tracking
steps the way that your hip it usually
does so it takes you know where you are
at this time here and then a later time
measures your distance and then it draws
a straight line in between those two
points to measure the distance so if you
walk in a circle and end up back near
point a at point B then you're actually
going to get much less credit for the
distance you walked than what you've
actually walked
if you're gonna be out playing a lot of
Pokemon you've definitely need some
battery packs I carried around a
backpack frequently that had a small
Armada of battery packs in it so that I
would never run out of juice the other
tip I have there is put your phone in
low battery mode the iPhone
automatically turns off low battery mode
when you get over 80% but I would go
right back into the settings and turn it
back on
